title: Industrial city
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Economic development - Environmental aspects
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Steel industry and trade - Australia

Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Industry - Social aspects
description: Episode of Series "Australian Geography". A study of industrial agglomeration as exemplified by the heavy industry of Newcastle, New South Wales. Establishes the essential industrial base of iron and steel production and the network of associated and supplier industries. Shows the interaction between coal, transport, steel and people. Raises environmental issues and poses a question: when will the agglomeration become uneconomic?
